a.span: Bullying and Prevention Policies and Procedures

header.h1: The Vision to See. The Courage to Try. The Will to Succeed.

div.h2: Why Choose The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter School?
div.p: The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter School is offering something that no other school in the area is…the ability to meet the needs of all different types of learners. Each child’s abilities are taken into consideration when developing and deploying our curriculum. At The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter, our Culture, Content and Curriculum are driven by the principle of Transformation Education, or TranZed, for short. The concept of TranZed is to provide a dynamic and current instructional focus through project based learning. By creating an engaging environment, dynamic and interactive content, and homing in on the specific needs of each child, we transform the way that our teachers teach and enable each child to reach his fullest potential.

With over 50 years of educational experience operating 5 additional schools in Maryland, The Children’s Guild knows what it takes to enable children at all levels to rise above. From our experienced principal and staff, to the operations management provided by The Children’s Guild and the TranZed Alliance, we embody the caring, commitment and courage that we seek to instill in the students we teach and care for each day. The difference between The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter School and other schools can be seen in the inventive and distinct artwork located throughout our building, which has a theme of giving children their voice; the technology we embrace to improve student performance; and the project based learning that has an emphasis on identity, the environment, leadership, and innovation.

The sky is the limit at The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter School. We firmly believe that each child has the potential to succeed and that it’s our job to find a way to help him get there. We give children the vision to see, the courage to try and the will to succeed.

a.strong: Letter to TCGDC Families on School Closure through June 19, 2020

a.p: Dear TCGDC Families, Due to the public health guidance in Washington DC, The Children’s Guild DC Public Charter School (TCGDC) will continue distance learning through the end of the school year with school concluding on Friday, June 19, 2020. While we continue to navigate these difficult times, the District of Columbia and TCGDC are considering the feasibility of summer learning options. We will share […]

a.strong: DC Launches Grocery Sites at DC Schools and Homebound Residents Food/Essential Items Delivery Service

a.p: On Monday, April 13, 2020, DC Mayor Muriel Bowser launched 10 weekday grocery distribution sites at District schools to help families access meals and other resources during the coronavirus (COVID-19) public health emergency. The grocery distribution sites are being launched in partnership with Martha’s Table and DC Central Kitchen. The sites are available to all families and […]

As the world fights COVID-19 and the resulting lockdowns and social distancing directives, families face challenges managing stress, talking with children and navigating life during this crisis. Dr. Sanaz Kumar, assistant medical director of The Children’s Guild Outpatient Mental Health Clinic and a staff psychiatrist at The Children’s Guild School of Prince George’s County, specializes […]

a.strong: Letter to TCGDC Families on School Closure through April 24, 2020

a.p: Dear TCGDC Families, Today, we are announcing that The Children’s’ Guild DC Public Charter School (TCGDC) will remain closed through Friday, April 24, 2020. In-person classes are expected to resume on Monday, April 27, 2020. Thank you for your support this past week and for your continued support in the weeks ahead as we come together […]
